2fd4cd057c89.title: Is there a word for the opposite of inspiring?

paragraphs.text: Is there a word for the opposite of inspiring? That’s what this article is. I mean, why even bother with artists at all if it’s so meaningless? Why not just take the photo through a photoshop filter and print it on canvas? Also, he points out how useful it is to exploit global inequality to get cheap labour abroad like he’s doing them a favour but in…
paragraphs.name: eb20

paragraphs.text: Fascinating to see some of the most effective known ways of painting quickly, and how economies of scale can bring more people what they want, including things that were popularly thought to be impossible to mass produce.

965454907e6d.title: While we can’t police against that, our main use case is portrait paintings.

paragraphs.text: While we can’t police against that, our main use case is portrait paintings. Probably 70% are portraits of humans, 20% pets, and 10% are landscapes. They’re pretty much all the customer’s own photos from their phones. We have no association with Instagram, or their photo sharing service. We definitely don’t advertise that we replicate other artist’s…
paragraphs.name: dbf9

paragraphs.text: Hey Chris,
paragraphs.name: b928

paragraphs.text: I just wanted to say that I’m not against the ethics or the core of your company (like most of these comments). This idea is deceptively amazing and most of the negativity here stems from the “mass-producing” part, which you stated you are NOT doing. I liken this to Etsy, and I’d say that this company is even MORE…

3a40a7c064d4.title: Really fascinating post, thank you for sharing it.

paragraphs.text: Really fascinating post, thank you for sharing it. One thing: where you say things like “Shenzhen, China’s most successful Special Economic Zone, and very close to Hong Kong — the gateway to China for foreign businessmen.” — I’m sure you mean businesspeople?

1714acf07ee0.title: Could you elaborate on how we’re driving out creatives?

paragraphs.text: Could you elaborate on how we’re driving out creatives? Are the artists we send orders to not good enough, not deserving of their work? I was born there, so I certainly hope Chinese people aren’t prejudiced by their race or country. I live with 2 artists in San Francisco, and American artists are under no threat from artists who paint lower cost…

9ef5eec12328.title: What do You offer to real artists ?

paragraphs.text:
What do You offer to real artists ? How do You honour their sensibility and
dedication — nurturing a culture of quality instead of quantity & cheapness ?

256b1d9b80c8.title: What have you done that is so meaningful, or do you just go around belittling people and their work…

paragraphs.text: What have you done that is so meaningful, or do you just go around belittling people and their work? The robot was a personal project I put on the Instapainting Blog. If you actually looked into it you’ll see that not only are we not using it for anything than a cool demo, it actually requires an artist to paint on it.
